hero.title: Escape Not, But a Path to Safety.

problem.title: Problem & Statistics
problem.stat2: Areas burned between 2021-2025 are the primary breeding grounds for over 500 wildlife species (mammals, birds, reptiles).
problem.stat3: Animals cannot analyze fire direction, so they inadvertently flee into the flames and become trapped.

solution.title: Solution: Acoustic Corridor Method
solution.desc1: Devices mounted at strategic points emit sounds at specific frequencies (20Hz - 20kHz) that animals can hear.
solution.desc2: Devices near the fire front sound high and frequent; distant devices sound at lower intensity, creating an instinctive "safe route."
solution.desc3: The gradual spread of sound guides animals away from the fire.

inventory.title: Component List
items: 2× ESP32 DevKit (USB programmable; same model preferred)
2× LoRa module: E32-900T20D (SX1276), SMA antenna connector
1× GSM/GPRS module: SIM800L (with antenna or antenna connector)
1× Resistor divider set (10k+20k or 10k+10k, SIM800L RX 2.8V)
1× USB programming cable (ESP32: Micro-USB or USB-C)

howItWorks.title: How It Works?
normalSteps: Gateways are installed at elevated points.
Devices are placed at intervals in fire-prone areas.
Gateways broadcast to satellites every minute.
Devices receive signals from satellites every minute.

fireCentral.title: Central Input
steps: Fire coordinates are drawn as a polygon at the center.
Data is sent from center to gateway via internet.
Devices near the fire front sound louder and more frequently; distant ones sound at lower levels or with delay.

fireSensor.title: Smoke Sensor Input
steps: A device's smoke sensor detects the fire.
The device triggers alarm and sends data to the center.
If the center confirms the fire, central procedure is applied.

footer.desc: IoT-based Acoustic Safety Corridor project that prevents animals from fleeing in the wrong direction during forest fires.
